title: Polar Coordinates - polar to rectangular complex

content.question: ​The complex number <math alttext="open parentheses r cos theta close parentheses plus i open parentheses r sin theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>i</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> can also be expressed in the form <math alttext="a plus b i"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>i</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. If <math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> indicates that the point corresponding to the complex number is above the real axis and left of the imaginary axis in the complex plane. Therefore, <math alttext="a less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

<math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> indicates that the point corresponding to the complex number is below the real axis and left of the imaginary axis in the complex plane. Therefore, <math alttext="a less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​<math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> indicates that the point corresponding to the complex number is above the real axis and left of the imaginary axis in the complex plane. Therefore, <math alttext="a greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​<math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> indicates that the point corresponding to the complex number is below the real axis and left of the imaginary axis in the complex plane. Therefore, <math alttext="a greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="r greater than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> indicates that the point corresponding to the complex number is below the real axis and left of the imaginary axis in the complex plane. Therefore, <math alttext="a less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="b less than 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
